column11:
This table provides the Spring 2017 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It captures both undergraduate and graduate instructional activity, adds graduate “extra credit,” and converts totals into standardized FTE values.

By School (Spring 2017):

Arts & Sciences – the largest unit, producing 56,071 total credit hours, equal to about 3,776 FTEs.

Business – generated 15,637 credit hours, translating to 1,063 FTEs.

Education & Professional Studies – contributed 16,163 credit hours, supporting 1,185 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – produced 38,140 credit hours, for 2,594 FTEs.

No School – very small, with 387 credit hours and 26 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – instructional credit hours taught at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – adjustment giving additional weight to graduate coursework.

Grand Total Credit Hours – total after adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – full-time equivalent enrollments (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
